title: Fake Social Media Account Detection
description: Digital Detective: Hunting Fakes in the Feed We built a machine that knows the difference between a person and a script.
details:
# üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Sosyal Medya Anomali Tespiti: Teknik Derinlik Raporu

**Tarih:** 13 Ocak 2026  
**Hazƒ±rlayan:** Serdar Dedeba≈ü  

---

## 1. Giri≈ü: Dijital Maskelerin Ardƒ±ndaki ƒ∞statistik

Sosyal medya platformlarƒ±, milyarlarca kullanƒ±cƒ±nƒ±n etkile≈üime girdiƒüi devasa veri okyanuslarƒ±dƒ±r. Ancak bu okyanusta, organik kullanƒ±cƒ±larƒ±n yanƒ± sƒ±ra, manip√ºlasyon amacƒ±yla √ºretilmi≈ü sentetik kimlikler (fake/bot hesaplar) de y√ºzmektedir. Bu projenin temel amacƒ±, bir sosyal medya hesabƒ±nƒ±n "insani" mi yoksa "yazƒ±lƒ±msal" mƒ± olduƒüunu istatistiksel izler √ºzerinden tespit etmektir.

Bu rapor, geli≈ütirilen yapay zeka modelinin teknik mimarisini, veri √ºzerindeki ke≈üiflerimizi, √∂zellik m√ºhendisliƒüi kararlarƒ±mƒ±zƒ± ve modelin karar mekanizmasƒ±nƒ± detaylƒ± bir ≈üekilde belgelemektedir. Amacƒ±mƒ±z sadece "bu hesap sahte" demek deƒüil, **"neden sahte olduƒüunu"** matematiksel kanƒ±tlarla sunmaktƒ±r.

---

## 2. Veri Ke≈üfi ve Analizi (Exploratory Data Analysis)

Her ba≈üarƒ±lƒ± makine √∂ƒürenmesi projesi, veriyi anlamakla ba≈ülar.

### 2.1. Veri Kaynaƒüƒ± ve √ñzellik Havuzu üóÇÔ∏è
Projede kullanƒ±lan veri seti, ger√ßek d√ºnya senaryolarƒ±nƒ± yansƒ±tmak amacƒ±yla **[Kaggle: Fake/Authentic User Instagram](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/krpurba/fakeauthentic-user-instagram)** kaynaƒüƒ±ndan temin edilmi≈ütir. Veri seti, kullanƒ±cƒ±larƒ±n profil bilgilerinden i√ßerik payla≈üƒ±m alƒ±≈ükanlƒ±klarƒ±na kadar geni≈ü bir yelpazede 18 farklƒ± √∂zellik i√ßermektedir.

Bu √∂zellikler, bir hesabƒ±n karakteristiƒüini ortaya koyan dijital parmak izleri gibidir:

**A. Hesap Profili √ñzellikleri**
*   **`pos` (Post Sayƒ±sƒ±):** Kullanƒ±cƒ±nƒ±n toplam payla≈ütƒ±ƒüƒ± g√∂nderi sayƒ±sƒ±. Botlar genelde ya √ßok az (yeni a√ßƒ±lmƒ±≈ü) ya da √ßok fazla (spam) g√∂nderiye sahiptir.
*   **`flg` (Takip Edilen):** Takip ettiƒüi ki≈üi sayƒ±sƒ±. Botlar genelde takip√ßi kazanmak i√ßin "Takibe Takip" (f4f) stratejisi izler.
*   **`flr` (Takip√ßi):** Hesabƒ± takip eden ki≈üi sayƒ±sƒ±.
*   **`bl` (Biyografi Uzunluƒüu):** Profil a√ßƒ±klamasƒ±ndaki karakter sayƒ±sƒ±.
*   **`pic` (Profil Resmi):** Profil resmi var mƒ± (1) yok mu (0). Ger√ßek kullanƒ±cƒ±larƒ±n √ßoƒüunda resim olurken, botlar bazen varsayƒ±lan avatarda kalƒ±r.
*   **`lin` (Dƒ±≈ü Baƒülantƒ±):** Biyografide link olup olmamasƒ±. Spam hesaplar genelde reklam veya zararlƒ± linkler barƒ±ndƒ±rƒ±r.

**B. ƒ∞√ßerik ve Payla≈üƒ±m √ñzellikleri**
*   **`cl` (A√ßƒ±klama Uzunluƒüu):** G√∂nderi altƒ±ndaki metinlerin ortalama karakter uzunluƒüu.
*   **`cz` (Bo≈ü A√ßƒ±klama Oranƒ±):** √áok kƒ±sa (3 karakterden az) a√ßƒ±klamalƒ± g√∂nderilerin oranƒ±. Botlar genelde a√ßƒ±klama yazmaz.
*   **`ni` (Resim Dƒ±≈üƒ± Medya):** Video veya kaydƒ±rmalƒ± (carousel) postlarƒ±n oranƒ±. Botlar genelde basit resimler y√ºkler.
*   **`lt` (Konum Etiketi):** G√∂nderilerde konum (lokasyon) kullanma oranƒ±.
*   **`hc` (Hashtag Sayƒ±sƒ±):** G√∂nderi ba≈üƒ±na ortalama etiket sayƒ±sƒ±.
*   **`cs` (Kosin√ºs Benzerliƒüi):** G√∂nderilerin birbirine ne kadar benzediƒüi. Botlar genelde aynƒ± a√ßƒ±klamayƒ± veya resmi tekrar tekrar payla≈üƒ±r (Y√ºksek skor = ≈û√ºpheli).
*   **`pi` (Payla≈üƒ±m Aralƒ±ƒüƒ±):** ƒ∞ki post arasƒ±ndaki ortalama s√ºre (saat). ƒ∞mkansƒ±z sƒ±kƒ±lƒ±kta ve d√ºzenlilikte payla≈üƒ±mlar bot belirtisidir.

**C. Etkile≈üim ve Anahtar Kelime √ñzellikleri**
*   **`erl` / `erc` (Etkile≈üim Oranlarƒ±):** Beƒüeni ve yorum sayƒ±sƒ±nƒ±n takip√ßi sayƒ±sƒ±na oranƒ±. Botlarƒ±n takip√ßisi √ßok ama etkile≈üimi (like/yorum) genelde √ßok d√º≈ü√ºkt√ºr.
*   **`pr` (Promosyon Kelimeleri):** "√áekili≈ü", "repost", "yarƒ±≈üma" gibi reklam i√ßerikli kelimelerin kullanƒ±m sƒ±klƒ±ƒüƒ±.
*   **`fo` (Takip√ßi Avcƒ± Kelimeleri):** "Takip et", "f4f", "beƒüen" gibi takip√ßi kasmaya y√∂nelik etiketlerin kullanƒ±m sƒ±klƒ±ƒüƒ±.
*   **`class` (Sƒ±nƒ±f):** Hedef deƒüi≈ükenimiz. `f` (fake/sahte) veya `r` (real/ger√ßek).

### 2.2. Sƒ±nƒ±f Daƒüƒ±lƒ±mƒ± ve Denge
Modelin √∂nyargƒ±lƒ± olmamasƒ± i√ßin veri setinin dengeli olmasƒ± kritiktir. Yaptƒ±ƒüƒ±mƒ±z analizde, "Ger√ßek" (Real) ve "Sahte" (Fake) hesaplarƒ±n birbirine yakƒ±n oranlarda daƒüƒ±ldƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ± g√∂rd√ºk. Bu, `Accuracy` (Doƒüruluk) metriƒüinin g√ºvenilir bir performans g√∂stergesi olabileceƒüini i≈üaret eder.

![Class Distribution](data:image/png;base64,)
*(Grafik 1: Veri setindeki Ger√ßek ve Sahte hesaplarƒ±n sayƒ±sal daƒüƒ±lƒ±mƒ±. Dengeli bir yapƒ±, modelin her iki sƒ±nƒ±fƒ± da e≈üit aƒüƒ±rlƒ±kta √∂ƒürenmesini saƒülar.)*

### 2.3. √ñzelliklerin Korelasyon Matrisi
Hangi √∂zelliklerin birbiriyle ili≈ükili olduƒüunu (Multicollinearity) ve hangilerinin hedef deƒüi≈ükenle (`class`) g√º√ßl√º baƒü kurduƒüunu anlamak i√ßin korelasyon matrisini inceledik.

*   **G√∂zlem:** Bazƒ± √∂zellikler (√∂rneƒüin takip√ßi sayƒ±sƒ± ve beƒüeni ortalamasƒ±) arasƒ±nda beklenen pozitif korelasyonlar vardƒ±r. Ancak bizim i√ßin asƒ±l √∂nemli olan, `class` (hedef) deƒüi≈ükeni ile olan ili≈ükilerdir.
*   **Yorum:** Koyu renkli alanlar, g√º√ßl√º ili≈ükileri temsil eder. √ñzellikle t√ºretilmi≈ü oranlarƒ±n (√∂rneƒüin takip√ßi/takip oranƒ±) hedef deƒüi≈ükenle ili≈ükisi dikkat √ßekicidir.

![Correlation Heatmap](data:image/png;base64,)
*(Grafik 2: √ñzellikler arasƒ± korelasyon haritasƒ±. Renkler ili≈ükinin y√∂n√ºn√º ve ≈üiddetini g√∂sterir.)*

### 2.4. Derinlemesine Bakƒ±≈ü: "Takip√ßi" ve "Etkile≈üim"
Sahte hesaplarƒ± ele veren en b√ºy√ºk a√ßƒ±k, davranƒ±≈üsal tutarsƒ±zlƒ±klardƒ±r.

*   **Takip√ßi (Followers):** Ger√ßek hesaplarda takip√ßi sayƒ±sƒ± genellikle logaritmik bir daƒüƒ±lƒ±m izler (az sayƒ±da ki≈üi √ßok takip√ßiye sahiptir). Sahte hesaplarda ise bu daƒüƒ±lƒ±m daha sentetiktir.
    ![Followers vs Class](data:image/png;base64,)
    *(Grafik 3: Takip√ßi sayƒ±larƒ±nƒ±n sƒ±nƒ±f bazƒ±nda daƒüƒ±lƒ±mƒ± (Boxplot). Aykƒ±rƒ± deƒüerlerin ve medyan farklarƒ±nƒ±n sƒ±nƒ±flarƒ± nasƒ±l ayƒ±rdƒ±ƒüƒ±na dikkat edin.)*

*   **Etkile≈üim (Engagement):** Bir bot hesabƒ± binlerce ki≈üiyi takip edebilir ama "ger√ßek" bir etkile≈üim (yorum/beƒüeni oranƒ±) yaratmak zordur. A≈üaƒüƒ±daki grafik, Beƒüeni Oranƒ± (`erl`) ve Yorum Oranƒ± (`erc`) arasƒ±ndaki ili≈ükiyi g√∂sterir. Sahte hesaplar genellikle d√º≈ü√ºk etkile≈üim k√ºmelerinde toplanƒ±rken, ger√ßek hesaplar daha geni≈ü bir alana yayƒ±lƒ±r.
    ![Engagement Scatter](data:image/png;base64,)
    *(Grafik 4: Beƒüeni ve Yorum oranlarƒ±nƒ±n sa√ßƒ±lƒ±m grafiƒüi. K√ºmeler arasƒ± ayrƒ±≈üma, modelin bu iki √∂zelliƒüi kullanarak karar verebileceƒüini kanƒ±tlar.)*

---

## 3. √ñzellik M√ºhendisliƒüi (Feature Engineering)

Ham veri, bir model i√ßin her zaman yeterli deƒüildir. Veriyi modelin "anlayabileceƒüi" bir dile √ßevirmek gerekir.

### 3.1. T√ºretilen ve Se√ßilen √ñzellikler
Modelin ba≈üarƒ±sƒ±nƒ±n %80'i doƒüru √∂zelliklerin se√ßimine baƒülƒ±dƒ±r.
*   **`ratio` (Takip√ßi / Takip Oranƒ±):** Bu, projenin "Yƒ±ldƒ±z √ñzelliƒüi"dir.
    *   *Mantƒ±k:* Bir bot genellikle takip√ßi kazanmak i√ßin "Takibe Takip" yapar. Bu da oranƒ±nƒ± 1.0'e √ßeker. Ger√ßek bir fenomende ise bu oran 1000'lere √ßƒ±kabilir.
*   **`ni` (Non-Image Ratio):** Videolu veya resimsiz i√ßerik oranƒ±. Bot yazƒ±lƒ±mlarƒ± metin tabanlƒ± etkile≈üimi sever, g√∂rsel i≈üleme maliyetlidir.

### 3.2. Dƒ±≈üarƒ±da Bƒ±rakƒ±lanlar (Dropped Features) üóëÔ∏è
Modeli laboratuvar ortamƒ±ndan √ßƒ±karƒ±p ger√ßek d√ºnyaya uyarlarken, "Teorik Maksimum Doƒüruluk" ile "Pratik Kullanƒ±labilirlik" arasƒ±nda bir takas (trade-off) yapmak zorunda kaldƒ±k. A≈üaƒüƒ±daki √∂zellikler, modelin eƒüitiminde etkili olsalar da, son kullanƒ±cƒ±nƒ±n manuel olarak hesaplamasƒ±nƒ±n imkansƒ±z veya √ßok zor olmasƒ± nedeniyle sistemden √ßƒ±karƒ±lmƒ±≈ütƒ±r:

*   **`pi` (Posting Interval - Payla≈üƒ±m Sƒ±klƒ±ƒüƒ±):** "Son 30 g√∂nderinin atƒ±lma saatleri arasƒ±ndaki standart sapma" gibi karma≈üƒ±k bir metrik. Bunu bir insanƒ±n hesaplamasƒ± dakikalar s√ºrer.
*   **`erl` & `erc` (Engagement Rate Likes/Comments):** Beƒüeni ve Yorum oranlarƒ±. Bunlar dinamiktir ve anlƒ±k olarak deƒüi≈üir. Kullanƒ±cƒ±dan "Toplam Beƒüeni / Toplam Post / Takip√ßi Sayƒ±sƒ±" form√ºl√ºn√º hesaplamasƒ±nƒ± istemek UX (Kullanƒ±cƒ± Deneyimi) katilidir.
*   **`pr` (Promotional Keywords):** ƒ∞√ßerikte ne kadar "#giveaway", "#repost" gibi promosyon kelimesi ge√ßtiƒüi. Bunu tespit etmek i√ßin kullanƒ±cƒ±nƒ±n NLP (Doƒüal Dil ƒ∞≈üleme) yapmasƒ± gerekir.
*   **`fo` (Follower Hunter Keywords):** "#follow4follow", "#like4like" gibi etiketlerin kullanƒ±m sƒ±klƒ±ƒüƒ±. Yine manuel tespiti √ßok zordur.

**Karar:** Bu √∂zellikleri √ßƒ±karmak modelin doƒüruluƒüundan √∂nemsiz bir miktar (binde 2-3 civarƒ±) g√∂t√ºrse de, sistemin herkes tarafƒ±ndan 10 saniye i√ßinde kullanƒ±labilir olmasƒ±nƒ± saƒülamƒ±≈ütƒ±r. "Hƒ±zlƒ± ve ƒ∞yi" bir model, "M√ºkemmel ama Kullanƒ±lamaz" bir modelden √ºst√ºnd√ºr.

![Feature Importance](data:image/png;base64,)
*(Grafik 5: Modelin karar verirken en √ßok hangi √∂zelliƒüe g√ºvendiƒüini g√∂steren √∂nem sƒ±ralamasƒ±. Listenin ba≈üƒ±ndaki √∂zellikler, sahte hesap avcƒ±larƒ±dƒ±r.)*

---

## 4. Model Se√ßimi ve Performans Kar≈üƒ±la≈ütƒ±rmasƒ± üå≤ vs üöÄ

Proje kapsamƒ±nda d√∂rt farklƒ± g√º√ßl√º algoritma "Arena"ya √ßƒ±karƒ±lmƒ±≈ü ve kƒ±yasƒ±ya yarƒ±≈ütƒ±rƒ±lmƒ±≈ütƒ±r. ƒ∞≈üte modellerin test seti √ºzerindeki performans karnesi:

| Model | Accuracy (Doƒüruluk) | F1-Score | ROC-AUC | Durum |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **XGBoost** | **0.8249** | **0.8177** | **0.9087** | ü•á (Skor Lideri) |
| **Random Forest** | 0.8222 | 0.8133 | 0.9038 | üå≤ **(Se√ßilen Model)** |
| **Neural Network (MLP)** | 0.8203 | 0.8093 | 0.9011 | Yarƒ±≈ümacƒ± |
| **Logistic Regression** | 0.7830 | 0.7752 | 0.8600 | Baseline (Taban) |

### Neden XGBoost Deƒüil de Random Forest? ü§î
Tabloya bakƒ±ldƒ±ƒüƒ±nda XGBoost'un matematiksel olarak (binde 2.7 farkla) daha √ºst√ºn olduƒüu g√∂r√ºlmektedir. Ancak m√ºhendislik kararlarƒ± sadece ham puana g√∂re verilmez. Projemizde **Random Forest**'ƒ±n ana model olarak se√ßilmesinin kritik sebepleri ≈üunlardƒ±r:

1.  **G√ºr√ºlt√ºye Diren√ß (Robustness):** XGBoost, hatalarƒ± minimize etmek i√ßin agresif (boosting) bir y√∂ntem izler. Sosyal medya verilerinde etiketlerin (ger√ßek/sahte) hatalƒ± olma ihtimali y√ºksektir. XGBoost bu hatalƒ± verileri "ezberleyip" (overfit) skoru yapay olarak ≈üi≈üirebilir. Random Forest ise "Bagging" y√∂ntemiyle √ßoƒüunluƒüun oyuna baktƒ±ƒüƒ± i√ßin bu tip g√ºr√ºlt√ºlere kar≈üƒ± daha diren√ßli ve g√ºvenilirdir.
2.  **Genellenebilirlik:** Binde 2'lik (%0.2) bir fark, ger√ßek hayatta ihmal edilebilir bir kazan√ßtƒ±r. Buna kar≈üƒ±lƒ±k Random Forest'ƒ±n yeni ve g√∂r√ºlmemi≈ü veri tiplerinde daha stabil √ßalƒ±≈üma eƒüilimi vardƒ±r.
3.  **A√ßƒ±klanabilirlik:** Projemizin amacƒ± "neden sahte?" sorusuna cevap vermektedir. Random Forest'ƒ±n karar mekanizmasƒ±, aƒüa√ß yapƒ±sƒ± sayesinde daha ≈üeffaf ve izlenebilirdir.

**Optimizasyon S√ºreci (GridSearchCV):**
Se√ßilen Random Forest modeli ham haliyle bƒ±rakƒ±lmamƒ±≈ü, 72 farklƒ± parametre kombinasyonu test edilerek evrimle≈ütirilmi≈ütir.
*   **`n_estimators`: 200** (Daha stabil karar i√ßin aƒüa√ß sayƒ±sƒ± iki katƒ±na √ßƒ±karƒ±ldƒ±)
*   **`min_samples_split`: 5** (A≈üƒ±rƒ± √∂ƒürenmeyi engellemek i√ßin filtre)
Modeli varsayƒ±lan ayarlarla bƒ±rakmadƒ±k. `GridSearchCV` tekniƒüi ile 72 farklƒ± kombinasyonu test ederek en iyi sonucu veren "Genetik Kodlarƒ±" bulduk. ƒ∞≈üte ≈üampiyon modelin parametreleri:

*   **`n_estimators` (Aƒüa√ß Sayƒ±sƒ±): 200** - Sistemde 200 farklƒ± karar aƒüacƒ± aynƒ± anda √ßalƒ±≈üƒ±r. (Standart 100'd√ºr, biz iki katƒ±na √ßƒ±kardƒ±k).
*   **`max_depth` (Derinlik): None** - Aƒüa√ßlarƒ±n sƒ±nƒ±rsƒ±z derinle≈ümesine izin verdik, b√∂ylece en ince detayƒ± bile yakalayabildiler.
*   **`min_samples_split`: 5** - Bir dalƒ±n ikiye ayrƒ±lmasƒ± i√ßin en az 5 veri noktasƒ± olmasƒ± ≈üartƒ±nƒ± ko≈ütuk (A≈üƒ±rƒ± ezberlemeyi √∂nlemek i√ßin).
*   **`min_samples_leaf`: 2** - Her yaprakta en az 2 hesap bulunmasƒ±nƒ± zorunlu kƒ±ldƒ±k.

---

## 5. Performans Deƒüerlendirmesi: Karnemiz Nasƒ±l? üìä

Modeli "Test Seti" (hi√ß g√∂rmediƒüi veriler) √ºzerinde zorlu bir sƒ±nava soktuk. Sonu√ßlar, g√ºvenilir bir sistem in≈üa ettiƒüimizi kanƒ±tlƒ±yor:

### 5.1. Metrikler ve Anlamlarƒ±
Sadece "Doƒüruluk" (Accuracy) tek ba≈üƒ±na yeterli deƒüildir. ƒ∞≈üte modelin detaylƒ± karnesi:

| Metrik | Deƒüer | Anlamƒ± |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Accuracy (Doƒüruluk)** | **%83.00** | Model her 100 hesabƒ±n 83 tanesini doƒüru bildi. |
| **F1-Score** | **0.83** | "Hem sahteyi hem ger√ßeƒüi dengeli bilme" puanƒ±. (1.0 √ºzerinden). |
| **Precision (Kesinlik)** | **0.83** | "Sahte" dediƒüimiz hesaplarƒ±n %83'√º ger√ßekten sahteydi. (Yanlƒ±≈ü alarm az). |
| **Recall (Duyarlƒ±lƒ±k)** | **0.83** | Piyasadaki t√ºm sahte hesaplarƒ±n %83'√ºn√º yakalayabildik. (Ka√ßan balƒ±k az). |

**Yorum:** %83'l√ºk doƒüruluk oranƒ±, sosyal medya gibi g√ºr√ºlt√ºl√º (hatalƒ± etiketlenmi≈ü verilerin olduƒüu) bir ortamda olduk√ßa ba≈üarƒ±lƒ±dƒ±r. F1 skorunun da 0.83 olmasƒ±, modelin "Sadece ger√ßekleri bulayƒ±m, sahteleri bo≈üvereyim" gibi bir kurnazlƒ±k yapmadƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ±, her iki sƒ±nƒ±fƒ± da e≈üit ba≈üarƒ±yla tanƒ±dƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ± g√∂sterir.

### 5.2. Confusion Matrix (Hata Matrisi)
Sadece nerede hata yaptƒ±ƒüƒ±mƒ±zƒ± g√∂rmek i√ßin matrise bakalƒ±m:
*   **False Positive (Yanlƒ±≈ü Alarm):** Ger√ßek birine "Sahte" deme oranƒ±mƒ±z d√º≈ü√ºkt√ºr.
*   **False Negative (Ka√ßan Balƒ±k):** Sahte birini "Ger√ßek" sanma oranƒ±mƒ±z d√º≈ü√ºkt√ºr.

A≈üaƒüƒ±daki matris, modelin kararlƒ±lƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ± g√∂rselle≈ütirir. K√∂≈üegen √ºzerindeki y√ºksek yoƒüunluk, ba≈üarƒ±nƒ±n kanƒ±tƒ±dƒ±r.

![Confusion Matrix](data:image/png;base64,)
*(Grafik 6: Test seti √ºzerindeki tahminlerin ger√ßek deƒüerlerle kar≈üƒ±la≈ütƒ±rƒ±lmasƒ±.)*

### 5.2. ROC Eƒürisi ve AUC
ROC eƒürisi, modelin ayƒ±rt etme g√ºc√ºn√º g√∂sterir. Eƒüri ne kadar sol √ºst k√∂≈üeye yakƒ±nsa, model o kadar m√ºkemmeldir. Bizim modelimiz, √ßizginin √ßok √ºzerinde bir performans sergileyerek rastgele bir tahminciden √ßok daha √ºst√ºn olduƒüunu kanƒ±tlamƒ±≈ütƒ±r.

**AUC (Area Under Curve) = 0.91** deƒüerinin projemizdeki pratik anlamƒ± ≈üudur:
1.  **Ayƒ±rt Etme G√ºc√º:** Sisteme rastgele bir **ger√ßek** ve bir **sahte** hesap verildiƒüinde, modelin sahte hesabƒ± ger√ßek hesaba g√∂re daha y√ºksek bir risk skoruyla doƒüru ayƒ±rt etme olasƒ±lƒ±ƒüƒ± **%91**'dir.
2.  **G√ºvenilirlik:** Ba≈üarƒ± ≈üansƒ±nƒ±n 0.50 olduƒüu (yazƒ±-tura) rastgele bir tahminciye kƒ±yasla; **0.91**'lik skor, modelin **"M√ºkemmel" (Excellent)** kategorisinde performans g√∂sterdiƒüini kanƒ±tlar. Bu, modelin sosyal medya gibi karma≈üƒ±k ve g√ºr√ºlt√ºl√º verilerde bile sahte hesaplarƒ± √ßok net bir ≈üekilde ayrƒ±≈ütƒ±rabildiƒüini g√∂sterir.

![ROC Curve](data:image/png;base64,)
*(Grafik 7: True Positive Rate vs False Positive Rate. Eƒürinin altƒ±ndaki alan (AUC), 0.91'lik deƒüeriyle modelin √ºst√ºn ba≈üarƒ±sƒ±nƒ± √∂zetler.)*

---

## 6. Hibrit Karar Mimarisi: ƒ∞statistik + Uzman Kuralƒ±

Veri setimiz 2017 yƒ±lƒ±ndan kalmaydƒ± ve o d√∂nemde "Mavi Tik" veya "√ñne √áƒ±kanlar" gibi kavramlar bug√ºnk√º kadar yaygƒ±n/anlamlƒ± deƒüildi. Model, Mavi Tik'in ne olduƒüunu **bilmiyor**.

Bu y√ºzden, saf Makine √ñƒürenmesi √ßƒ±ktƒ±sƒ±nƒ± (0 ile 1 arasƒ± bir risk skoru), uzman kurallarƒ±yla (Rule-Based) harmanlayan bir **Hibrit Mimari** tasarladƒ±k.

Bu mimari, **"ƒ∞leri Beslemeli Risk Hesaplama ve Geri Beslemeli Ceza Sistemi"** (Feed-Forward Risk Calculation with Feedback Penalty) prensibine dayanƒ±r. Sistem iki a≈üamalƒ± √ßalƒ±≈üƒ±r:

**1. A≈üama: ƒ∞statistiksel Risk Tahmini (The Mathematical Core)**
ƒ∞lk adƒ±mda, Random Forest modeli hesabƒ±n sadece sayƒ±sal verilerine (takip√ßi sayƒ±sƒ±, takip edilen sayƒ±sƒ±, g√∂nderi sƒ±klƒ±ƒüƒ± vb.) bakar. Bu a≈üamada model, hesabƒ±n "kim" olduƒüuyla ilgilenmez, sadece rakamlarƒ±n olu≈üturduƒüu deseni inceler. Model, 0 ile 1 arasƒ±nda ham bir **"Yapay Zeka Risk Skoru"** √ºretir (√ñrneƒüin: 0.95 - Y√ºksek Olasƒ±lƒ±kla Sahte).

**2. A≈üama: Baƒülamsal G√ºven ƒ∞ndirimi (Contextual Reliability Discount)**
ƒ∞kinci a≈üamada, modelin eƒüitim setinde bulunmayan ancak ger√ßek d√ºnyada g√ºvenilirlik sinyali olarak kabul edilen "sosyal kanƒ±tlar" devreye girer. Bu sinyaller (Mavi Tik, Kaydƒ±rmalƒ± Post, √ñne √áƒ±kan Hikayeler), hesaplanan risk skorunu "cezalandƒ±rƒ±r", yani a≈üaƒüƒ± √ßeker.

Bu i≈ülem basit bir √ßƒ±karma i≈ülemi deƒüil, **√ßarpƒ±msal bir s√∂n√ºmleme** (multiplicative decay) i≈ülemidir:

$$ FinalRisk = HamRisk \times (1 - G√ºvenFakt√∂r√º_1) \times (1 - G√ºvenFakt√∂r√º_2) ... $$

*   **Mavi Tik (Verified Badge):** En g√º√ßl√º g√ºven sinyalidir. Risk skorunu doƒürudan %15 oranƒ±nda s√∂n√ºmler.
*   **Kaydƒ±rmalƒ± Post (Carousel):** Tek bir g√∂nderide birden fazla medyanƒ±n payla≈üƒ±lmasƒ± (saƒüa kaydƒ±rmalƒ± alb√ºm), basit bot yazƒ±lƒ±mlarƒ±nƒ±n genellikle yapamadƒ±ƒüƒ± bir eylemdir. Bu "insani efor" g√∂stergesi, risk skorunu %15 oranƒ±nda azaltƒ±r.
*   **√ñne √áƒ±kanlar (Highlights):** Hikaye ar≈üivi olu≈üturmak, bir bot yazƒ±lƒ±mƒ± i√ßin karma≈üƒ±k ve maliyetli bir s√ºre√ßtir. Bu √∂zellik, hesabƒ±n arkasƒ±nda ger√ßek bir insan olduƒüunun g√º√ßl√º bir g√∂stergesidir ve riski %5 oranƒ±nda azaltƒ±r.

**Sonu√ß:**
Model, bir hesaba matematiksel olarak %90 oranƒ±nda "Sahte" dese bile, eƒüer o hesap "Mavi Tikli" ve "√ñne √áƒ±kanlara Sahip" ise, risk skoru dramatik bir ≈üekilde d√º≈ü√ºr√ºlerek (%90 -> %72 -> %68) g√ºvenli b√∂lgeye (Ger√ßek Hesap) √ßekilir. Bu yakla≈üƒ±m, yapay zekanƒ±n katƒ± kurallarƒ±nƒ±, insan sezgisiyle esneterek "False Positive" (Yanlƒ±≈ü Alarm) oranƒ±nƒ± minimize eder.

Bu mimari sayesinde:
1.  **Adaptasyon:** Model yeniden eƒüitilmeden yeni kurallar (√∂rn. yeni bir rozet t√ºr√º) sisteme eklenebilir.
2.  **G√ºven:** Veri setinin eksik kaldƒ±ƒüƒ± yerlerde "ƒ∞nsan Zekasƒ±" devreye girer.

---

## 7. Sonu√ß ve Yorum

Bu proje, bir "Sƒ±nƒ±flandƒ±rma" probleminden fazlasƒ±dƒ±r; dijital bir dedektiflik √ßalƒ±≈ümasƒ±dƒ±r.

*   √áƒ±plak g√∂zle "normal" g√∂r√ºnen bir hesap, **Takip√ßi/Takip oranƒ±** ve **ƒ∞√ßerik T√ºr√º Dengesizliƒüi** (`ni`) sayesinde model tarafƒ±ndan anƒ±nda yakalanabilmektedir.
*   **Feature Selection** (√ñzellik Se√ßimi) a≈üamasƒ±nda yaptƒ±ƒüƒ±mƒ±z elemeler, modelin hem hafif hem de sahada uygulanabilir olmasƒ±nƒ± saƒülamƒ±≈ütƒ±r.
*   Tasarladƒ±ƒüƒ±mƒ±z **Hibrit Mimari**, saf yapay zekanƒ±n "k√∂r noktalarƒ±nƒ±" (baƒülam eksikliƒüi) basit ama etkili kurallarla kapatmƒ±≈ütƒ±r.

Sonu√ß olarak ortaya √ßƒ±kan sistem; veriye dayalƒ±, istatistiksel, a√ßƒ±klanabilir ve y√ºksek doƒüruluklu bir anomali tespit motorudur.

---
details_en:
# üïµÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Social Media Anomaly Detection: Technical Depth Report

**Date:** January 13, 2026 
**Prepared By:** Serdar Dedebas

---

## 1. Introduction: Statistics Behind Digital Masks

Social media platforms are vast oceans of data where billions of users interact. However, swimming alongside organic users in this ocean are synthetic identities (fake/bot accounts) created for manipulation. The primary goal of this project is to detect whether a social media account is "human" or "software" based on statistical traces.

This report documents the technical architecture of the developed AI model, our discoveries on the data, feature engineering decisions, and the model's decision mechanism in detail. Our aim is not just to say "this account is fake," but to present **"why it is fake"** with mathematical proofs.

---

## 2. Data Discovery and Analysis (Exploratory Data Analysis)

Every successful machine learning project begins with understanding the data.

### 2.1. Data Source and Feature Pool üóÇÔ∏è
The dataset used in the project was obtained from **[Kaggle: Fake/Authentic User Instagram](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/krpurba/fakeauthentic-user-instagram)** to reflect real-world scenarios. The dataset contains 18 different features ranging from user profile information to content sharing habits.

These features are like digital fingerprints revealing the characteristics of an account:

**A. Account Profile Features**
*   **`pos` (Number of Posts):** Total number of posts shared by the user. Bots usually have either very few (newly opened) or too many (spam) posts.
*   **`flg` (Following):** Number of people the user follows. Bots generally follow many people to gain followers (Follow-for-Follow).
*   **`flr` (Followers):** Number of people following the account.
*   **`bl` (Bio Length):** Character count of the profile description.
*   **`pic` (Profile Picture):** Whether there is a profile picture (1) or not (0). Most real users have a picture, whereas bots sometimes stay with the default avatar.
*   **`lin` (External Link):** Presence of a link in the bio. Spam accounts often contain ad or malicious links.

**B. Content and Sharing Features**
*   **`cl` (Caption Length):** Average character length of the text under posts.
*   **`cz` (Empty Caption Ratio):** Ratio of posts with very short descriptions (less than 3 characters). Bots usually don't write descriptions.
*   **`ni` (Non-Image Media):** Ratio of video or carousel posts. Bots generally upload simple images.
*   **`lt` (Location Tag):** Ratio of using location tags in posts.
*   **`hc` (Hashtag Count):** Average number of tags per post.
*   **`cs` (Cosine Similarity):** How similar the posts are to each other. Bots usually share the same description or image repeatedly (High score = Suspicious).
*   **`pi` (Posting Interval):** Average time between two posts (in hours). Impossible tightness and regularity are signs of a bot.

**C. Engagement and Keyword Features**
*   **`erl` / `erc` (Engagement Rates):** Ratio of likes and comments to the number of followers. Bots have many followers but generally very low interaction (like/comment).
*   **`pr` (Promotional Keywords):** Frequency of use of ad-content words like "Giveaway", "repost", "contest".
*   **`fo` (Follower Hunter Keywords):** Frequency of use of tags aimed at gaining followers like "follow me", "f4f", "like".
*   **`class` (Class):** Our target variable. `f` (fake) or `r` (real).

### 2.2. Class Distribution and Balance
For the model not to be biased, it is critical that the dataset is balanced. In our analysis, we saw that "Real" and "Fake" accounts are distributed in close proportions. This indicates that the `Accuracy` metric can be a reliable performance indicator.

![Class Distribution](data:image/png;base64,)
*(Chart 1: Numerical distribution of Real and Fake accounts in the dataset. A balanced structure ensures the model learns both classes with equal weight.)*

### 2.3. Correlation Matrix of Features
We examined the correlation matrix to understand which features are related to each other (Multicollinearity) and which have a strong connection with the target variable (`class`).

*   **Observation:** There are expected positive correlations between some features (e.g., follower count and average likes). However, what matters for us is the relationships with the `class` (target) variable.
*   **Interpretation:** Dark areas represent strong relationships. Especially the relationship of derived ratios (e.g., follower/following ratio) with the target variable is noteworthy.

![Correlation Heatmap](data:image/png;base64,)
*(Chart 2: Correlation map between features. Colors show the direction and intensity of the relationship.)*

### 2.4. Deep Dive: "Followers" and "Engagement"
The biggest vulnerability that reveals fake accounts is behavioral inconsistencies.

*   **Followers:** In real accounts, the follower count usually follows a logarithmic distribution (few people have many followers). In fake accounts, this distribution is more synthetic.
    ![Followers vs Class](data:image/png;base64,)
    *(Chart 3: Distribution of follower counts by class (Boxplot). Note how outliers and median differences separate the classes.)*

*   **Engagement:** A bot account might follow thousands of people, but it is hard to create "real" engagement (comment/like ratio). The chart below shows the relationship between Like Rate (`erl`) and Comment Rate (`erc`). Fake accounts generally cluster in low engagement areas, while real accounts spread to a wider area.
    ![Engagement Scatter](data:image/png;base64,)
    *(Chart 4: Scatter plot of Like and Comment rates. The separation between clusters proves the model can decide using these two features.)*

---

## 3. Feature Engineering

Raw data is not always sufficient for a model. It is necessary to translate the data into a language the model can "understand".

### 3.1. Derived and Selected Features
80% of the model's success depends on the selection of the right features.
*   **`ratio` (Follower / Following Ratio):** This is the "Star Feature" of the project.
    *   *Logic:* A bot usually does "Follow for Follow" to gain followers. This pulls the ratio to 1.0. In a real phenomenon, this ratio can go up to 1000s.
*   **`ni` (Non-Image Ratio):** Ratio of video or image-less content. Bot software likes text-based interaction; image processing is costly.

### 3.2. Dropped Features üóëÔ∏è
When taking the model out of the lab and adapting it to the real world, we had to make a trade-off between "Theoretical Maximum Accuracy" and "Practical Usability". The following features, although effective in training the model, were removed from the system because it is impossible or very difficult for the end-user to calculate them manually:

*   **`pi` (Posting Interval):** A complex metric like "Standard deviation between the posting hours of the last 30 posts". It takes minutes for a human to calculate this.
*   **`erl` & `erc` (Engagement Rate Likes/Comments):** Like and Comment rates. These are dynamic and change instantly. Asking the user to calculate the "Total Likes / Total Posts / Follower Count" formula is a UX (User Experience) killer.
*   **`pr` (Promotional Keywords):** How many promotional words like "#giveaway", "#repost" appear in the content. The user would need to perform NLP (Natural Language Processing) to detect this.
*   **`fo` (Follower Hunter Keywords):** Frequency of usage of tags like "#follow4follow", "#like4like". Again, manual detection is very difficult.

**Decision:** Although removing these features took away an insignificant amount (around 0.2-0.3%) from the model's accuracy, it ensured the system is usable by everyone within 10 seconds. A "Fast and Good" model is superior to a "Perfect but Unusable" model.

![Feature Importance](data:image/png;base64,)
*(Chart 5: Importance ranking showing which feature the model relies on most when deciding. Features at the top of the list are fake account hunters.)*

---

## 4. Model Selection and Performance Comparison üå≤ vs üöÄ

Within the scope of the project, four different powerful algorithms were brought to the "Arena" and raced fiercely. Here is the performance report card of the models on the test set:

| Model | Accuracy | F1-Score | ROC-AUC | Status |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **XGBoost** | **0.8249** | **0.8177** | **0.9087** | ü•á (Score Leader) |
| **Random Forest** | 0.8222 | 0.8133 | 0.9038 | üå≤ **(Selected Model)** |
| **Neural Network (MLP)** | 0.8203 | 0.8093 | 0.9011 | Contender |
| **Logistic Regression** | 0.7830 | 0.7752 | 0.8600 | Baseline |

### Why Random Forest and Not XGBoost? ü§î
Looking at the table, it is seen that XGBoost is mathematically superior (by a difference of 0.2%). However, engineering decisions are not made solely based on raw scores. The critical reasons why **Random Forest** was selected as the main model in our project are:

1.  **Robustness:** XGBoost follows an aggressive (boosting) method to minimize errors. In social media data, the probability of labels (real/fake) being incorrect is high. XGBoost might "memorize" (overfit) these incorrect data and artificially inflate the score. Random Forest, on the other hand, is more resistant and reliable against such noise because it looks at the majority vote with the "Bagging" method.
2.  **Generalizability:** A difference of 0.2% is a negligible gain in real life. In contrast, Random Forest tends to work more stably on new and unseen data types.
3.  **Explainability:** The aim of our project is to answer the question "why is it fake?". Random Forest's decision mechanism is more transparent and traceable thanks to its tree structure.

**Optimization Process (GridSearchCV):**
The selected Random Forest model was not left in its raw state, but evolved by testing 72 different parameter combinations.
*   **`n_estimators`: 200** (Number of trees doubled for a more stable decision)
*   **`min_samples_split`: 5** (Filter to prevent overfitting)
We didn't leave the model with default settings. We found the "Genetic Codes" that gave the best result by testing 72 different combinations with the `GridSearchCV` technique. Here are the champion model's parameters:

*   **`n_estimators` (Number of Trees): 200** - 200 different decision trees work simultaneously in the system. (Standard is 100, we doubled it).
*   **`max_depth` (Depth): None** - We allowed the trees to deepen unlimitedly, so they could catch even the finest detail.
*   **`min_samples_split`: 5** - We required at least 5 data points for a branch to split into two (To prevent overfitting).
*   **`min_samples_leaf`: 2** - We mandated at least 2 accounts in each leaf.

---

## 5. Performance Evaluation: How is Our Report Card? üìä

We put the model through a tough exam on the "Test Set" (data it has never seen). The results prove that we have built a reliable system:

### 5.1. Metrics and Meanings
Just "Accuracy" alone is not enough. Here is the detailed report card of the model:

| Metric | Value | Meaning |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Accuracy** | **%83.00** | The model correctly identified 83 out of every 100 accounts. |
| **F1-Score** | **0.83** | The score of "knowing both fake and real balanced". (Out of 1.0). |
| **Precision** | **0.83** | 83% of the accounts we called "Fake" were actually fake. (False alarm is low). |
| **Recall** | **0.83** | We were able to catch 83% of all fake accounts in the market. (Few missed fish). |

**Comment:** An accuracy rate of 83% is quite successful in a noisy environment (where there is mislabeled data) like social media. The F1 score being 0.83 shows that the model does not try to be cunning like "Just find the real ones, ignore the fakes", but recognizes both classes with equal success.

### 5.2. Confusion Matrix
Let's look at the matrix just to see where we made mistakes:
*   **False Positive (False Alarm):** Our rate of calling a real person "Fake" is low.
*   **False Negative (Missed Fish):** Our rate of mistaking a fake person for "Real" is low.

The matrix below visualizes the stability of the model. High density on the diagonal is proof of success.

![Confusion Matrix](data:image/png;base64,)
*(Chart 6: Comparison of predictions on the test set with actual values.)*

### 5.3. ROC Curve and AUC
The ROC curve shows the discrimination power of the model. The closer the curve is to the top left corner, the more perfect the model is. Our model proved to be far superior to a random predictor by performing well above the line.

**AUC (Area Under Curve) = 0.91** value has the following practical meaning in our project:
1.  **Discrimination Power:** When given a random **real** and a **fake** account, the probability of the model correctly distinguishing the fake account with a higher risk score than the real account is **%91**.
2.  **Reliability:** Compared to a random predictor with a 50% chance of success (coin toss); the score of **0.91** proves that the model performs in the **"Excellent"** category. This shows that the model can clearly separate fake accounts even in complex and noisy data like social media.

![ROC Curve](data:image/png;base64,)
*(Chart 7: True Positive Rate vs False Positive Rate. The area under the curve (AUC) summarizes the model's superior success with a value of 0.91.)*

---

## 6. Hybrid Decision Architecture: Statistics + Expert Rule

Our dataset was from 2017, and concepts like "Blue Tick" or "Highlights" were not as common/meaningful back then. The model **does not know** what a Blue Tick is.

Therefore, we designed a **Hybrid Architecture** that blends pure Machine Learning output (a risk score between 0 and 1) with expert rules (Rule-Based).

This architecture is based on the **"Feed-Forward Risk Calculation with Feedback Penalty"** principle. The system works in two stages:

**Stage 1: Statistical Risk Prediction (The Mathematical Core)**
In the first step, the Random Forest model looks only at the numerical data of the account (follower count, following count, posting frequency, etc.). At this stage, the model does not care "who" the account is, it only examines the pattern formed by the numbers. The model produces a raw **"AI Risk Score"** between 0 and 1 (Example: 0.95 - High Probability Fake).

**Stage 2: Contextual Reliability Discount**
In the second stage, "social proofs" that are not in the model's training set but are accepted as reliability signals in the real world come into play. These signals (Blue Tick, Carousel Post, Highlight Stories) "penalize", i.e., pull down, the calculated risk score.

This process is not a simple subtraction, but a **multiplicative decay** process:

$$ FinalRisk = RawRisk \\times (1 - TrustFactor_1) \\times (1 - TrustFactor_2) ... $$

*   **Verified Badge (Blue Tick):** It is the strongest trust signal. It directly dampens the risk score by 15%.
*   **Carousel Post:** Sharing multiple media in a single post (album with right swipe) is an action that simple bot software usually cannot do. This "human effort" indicator reduces the risk score by 15%.
*   **Highlights:** Creating a story archive is a complex and costly process for bot software. This feature is a strong indicator that there is a real human behind the account and reduces the risk by 5%.

**Result:**
Even if the model mathematically says "Fake" by 90% for an account, if that account is "Blue Ticked" and "Has Highlights", the risk score is dramatically reduced (%90 -> %72 -> %68) and pulled to the safe zone (Real Account). This approach minimizes the "False Positive" (False Alarm) rate by stretching the strict rules of artificial intelligence with human intuition.

Thanks to this architecture:
1.  **Adaptation:** New rules (e.g., a new type of badge) can be added to the system without retraining the model.
2.  **Trust:** "Human Intelligence" steps in where the dataset falls short.

---

## 7. Conclusion and Comment

This project is more than a "Classification" problem; it is a digital detective work.

*   An account that looks "normal" to the naked eye can be instantly caught by the model thanks to the **Follower/Following ratio** and **Content Type Imbalance** (`ni`).
*   The eliminations we made during the **Feature Selection** phase ensured that the model is both light and applicable in the field.
*   The **Hybrid Architecture** we designed covered the "blind spots" of pure artificial intelligence (lack of context) with simple but effective rules.

As a result, the resulting system is a data-driven, statistical, explainable, and high-accuracy anomaly detection engine.

---
